subject: Re: [junit] Testability
msgSnippet: What s more important: 100% coverage is nice, but not required or even important. 98% is good enough. So said  Scott Stirling  on  2003-02-04
messageBody:
What's more important: 100% coverage is nice, but not required or even
important. 98% is good enough.

So said Scott Stirling on 2003-02-04 --------------------

>I've been thinking about Test Driven Development and the question of
what
>is
>it about it that ensures testability. As Kent Beck says, if you
follow TDD
>religiously, you should have 100% statement coverage for your code.
Let me
>repeat that: 100%. I've also been thinking about this concept of
>"testability" and what it means (incidentally, I think
"maintainability" is
>also pretty reducible to the explanation offered below).
<snip />


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
